Data.event_text: Researchers led by the UK's Institute of Cancer Research describe a new light-activated 'photoimmunotherapy' for brain cancer. They believe it could join surgery, chemotherapy, radiotherapy and immunotherapy as a fifth major form of cancer treatment.

links.text: -"Scientists harness light therapy to target and kill cancer cells in world first". The Guardian. 17 June 2022. Retrieved 21 June 2022.-
-"Light-activated 'photoimmunotherapy' could enhance brain cancer treatment". Institute of Cancer Research. 16 June 2022. Retrieved 21 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Home Secretary Priti Patel approves the extradition of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to the United States, where he faces up to 175 years in jail for violating the Espionage Act. He is given 14 days to appeal.

links.text: -"Julian Assange can be extradited, says UK home secretary". BBC News. 17 June 2022. Retrieved 17 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: The hottest day of the year in the UK is recorded for a third consecutive day. Santon Downham, in Suffolk, is measured at 32.7 °C (90 °F), surpassing the previous day's high of 29.5 °C (85.1 °F) at Northolt, west London.

links.text: -"UK weather: Hottest day of the year again for third day in a row". BBC News. 17 June 2022. Retrieved 17 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The latest Office for National Statistics figures indicate another rise in COVID-19 cases, with the Platinum Jubilee celebrations thought to have contributed to the increase. Figures show 1.4 million people with the virus, or one in 45, a rise from one in 65 the previous week.

links.text: -"Covid infections up after Platinum Jubilee celebrations". BBC News. 17 June 2022. Retrieved 17 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: A body found in the Vale do Javari in Amazonas, Brazil on 13 June is proved to be that of missing British journalist Dom Phillips.

links.text: -"British journalist, indigenous expert found dead in Brazil -report". Reuters. 13 June 2022. Retrieved 20 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: The National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers confirms the rail and tube strikes planned for 21, 23 and 25 June will go ahead, after talks to resolve the situation ended without agreement.

links.text: -"Rail and tube strikes confirmed as talks fail". BBC News. 18 June 2022. Retrieved 18 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Thousands of protesters march through London to demand action from the government on the cost of living crisis.RMT union members striking outside Network Rail property in Cambridge on 21

links.text: -"Workers take to London's streets amid cost of living crisis". BBC News. 18 June 2022. Retrieved 19 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: 21 June  The biggest rail strike since 1989 takes place, affecting 80% of services across England, Scotland and Wales, including the London Underground. Unions claim that Network Rail is threatening to cut safety-critical jobs (a characterisation that Network Rail rejects) as part of its modernisation programme, which would also include an increase in working hours. Rail workers also demand pay rises to keep up with soaring inflation. However, critics of the strike point to changing commuter habits, such as ticket offices being nearly obsolete, as well as more working from home, and the need for efficiency improvements.

links.text: -"Rail strike disrupts journeys for millions". BBC News. 21 June 2022. Retrieved 21 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Inflation increases to 9.1%, from 9% last month.

links.text: -"Inflation hits fresh 40-year high of 9.1% amid cost of living crisis". Sky News. 22 June 2022. Retrieved 22 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: The UK Health Security Agency declares a national incident after poliovirus is found in sewage samples collected from the Beckton Sewage Treatment Works, East London.

links.text: -"National incident declared over polio virus findings in London sewage". The Guardian. 22 June 2022. Retrieved 22 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: The UK is hit by a second day of rail strikes. RMT boss Mick Lynch warns that further strikes are "extremely likely" if talks to resolve the dispute continue to fail.

links.text: -"More rail strikes extremely likely, says union boss". BBC News. 23 June 2022. Retrieved 23 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2022 Wakefield by-election Labour regain the seat from the Conservatives with a 47.9% vote share.
2022 Tiverton and Honiton by-election The Liberal Democrats gain the seat, overturning a substantial Conservative majority of 24,239.

links.text: -"Tories lose two key byelections on same night in Wakefield and Tiverton and Honiton". The Guardian. 24 June 2022. Retrieved 24 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The latest Office for National Statistics data suggests another rise in the number of people infected with COVID, with 1.7 million people with the virus in the week up to 18 June, roughly one in 38.

links.text: -"Covid: UK infections continuing to rise". BBC News. 24 June 2022. Retrieved 24 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: International chemicals firm Tata Chemicals Europe opens the UK's first industrial-scale carbon capture and utilisation plant in Northwich, Cheshire.

links.text: -"Tata Chemicals Europe opens UK's first industrial scale carbon capture and usage plant". The Engineer. 24 June 2022. Retrieved 28 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: 25 June  A third day of rail strikes are held across the country.

links.text: -"Rail strikes: Travellers hit by third day of disruption". BBC News. 25 June 2022. Retrieved 25 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: SNP MP Patrick Grady resigns party membership and will sit as an independent in the House of Commons.

links.text: -"Patrick Grady to step away from SNP membership over allegations". BBC News. 26 June 2022. Retrieved 26 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Murder of Zara Aleena
27 June  Barristers walk out of courts across England and Wales in a dispute over legal aid funding.

links.text: -"Barristers walk out of courts in strike over legal aid funding". BBC News. 27 June 2022. Retrieved 27 June 2022.-
-"Criminal barristers begin strike in row over legal aid fees". The Guardian. 27 June 2022. Retrieved 27 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon proposes 19 October 2023 as the date for a second referendum on independence.

links.text: -"Scottish independence: 19 October 2023 proposed as date for referendum". BBC News. 28 June 2022. Retrieved 28 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Initial results from the 2021 census are published, showing a 6.3% rise in the population of England and Wales since the previous census in 2011, one of the biggest increases on record. The population of England and Wales is 59,597,300, while the UK is estimated at 66,966,400. The figures show more people aged over 65 than ever before.

links.text: -"Census: Population of England and Wales grew 6% in a decade". BBC News. 28 June 2022. Retrieved 28 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2022 monkeypox outbreak The number of cases recorded in the UK exceeds 1,000.

links.text: -"Monkeypox cases in the UK rise to more than 1,000, latest figures show". Sky News. 28 June 2022. Retrieved 28 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK A public inquiry begins into the UK's handling of the pandemic.

links.text: -"Delayed public inquiry into UK's Covid-19 response opens". The Guardian. 28 June 2022. Retrieved 28 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: 29 June  The Climate Change Committee publishes its largest UK climate progress report to date, warning that the UK will fail to achieve net zero by 2050 under current policies.

links.text: -"Current programmes will not deliver Net Zero". Climate Change Committee. 29 June 2022. Retrieved 29 June 2022.-
-"'We are worried': UK climate advisors slam 'shocking' lack of net zero delivery". Business Green. 29 June 2022. Retrieved 29 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: An additional £1 billion in funding for military aid to Ukraine is announced.

links.text: -"Ukraine War: UK pledges an extra £1bn in military support". BBC News. 30 June 2022. Retrieved 30 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Former SNP MP Natalie McGarry is jailed for two years for embezzling £25,000.

links.text: -"Former SNP MP Natalie McGarry jailed for embezzling £25,000". BBC News. 30 June 2022. Retrieved 30 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Tamworth MP Chris Pincher resigns as Conservative Party deputy chief whip, saying he "embarrassed myself and other people" and "drank far too much" following an incident at a party the previous evening.

links.text: -"Tory whip resigns saying he 'embarrassed himself'". BBC News. 30 June 2022. Retrieved 30 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2022 monkeypox outbreak Professor Kevin Fenton of Public Health England urges anyone with monkeypox symptoms  blisters, fevers, and swollen glands  not to attend Pride events over the weekend.

links.text: -"Pride: Stay at home if you have monkeypox symptoms". BBC News. 30 June 2022. Retrieved 30 June 2022.-

Data.event_text: Leasehold Reform (Ground Rent) Act 2022 comes into force, effectively abolishing ground rent for newly built residential properties in England and Wales.

links.text: -House of Commons Library (25 July 2023). "Leasehold reform in England and Wales: What's happening and when?". UK Parliament. Retrieved 9 August 2023.-

Data.event_text: Chris Pincher has the Conservative Party Whip withdrawn and will sit in the House of Commons as an independent MP. A formal complaint about his conduct is also lodged with the Independent Complaints and Grievance Scheme (ICGS).

links.text: -"Chris Pincher: Watchdog to examine allegations against former Tory MP". BBC News. 2 July 2022. Retrieved 10 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK Office for National Statistics data suggests COVID-19 cases in the UK are rising again, with 2.3 million people infected with the virus, around one in 30, in the week ending 24 June. The statistics show a 32% rise on the previous week, with the Omicron BA.4 and BA.5 variants thought to be responsible for the rise.

links.text: -"Covid infections jump by half a million in UK, says ONS". BBC News. 1 July 2022. Retrieved 2 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2 July  Members of the ASLEF union stage their second strike in two weeks, in a dispute over pay, affecting 90% of train services operated by Greater Anglia.

links.text: -"Train drivers' strike to hit more than 90% of Greater Anglia services". The Guardian. 2 July 2022. Retrieved 2 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: A further six allegations against Chris Pincher emerge, involving behaviour over a decade. One complainant is reported to have given 10 Downing Street details in February 2022 and expressed concerns over Pincher becoming a whip in charge of other MPs' welfare. Work and Pensions Secretary Therese Coffey tells the BBC Prime Minister Boris Johnson was not aware of "specific allegations" against Pincher at the time of his appointment as Deputy Chief Whip in February 2022.

links.text: -Snowdon, Kathryn; Seddon, Paul (3 July 2022). "Chris Pincher: New claims emerge against former Tory MP". BBC News. Retrieved 3 July 2022.-
-"Chris Pincher: New claims emerge against former Tory MP". BBC News. 3 July 2022. Retrieved 10 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Carlos Sainz wins the 2022 British Grand Prix, taking his maiden race win in the Formula One World Championship.

links.text: -Brown, Oliver; Slater, Luke (3 July 2022). "Carlos Sainz wins British GP as Lewis Hamilton fights his way onto podium in crash-hit Silverstone thriller". www.telegraph.co.uk. Retrieved 5 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: 4 July  The number of pubs in England and Wales falls below 40,000 to its lowest level on record, driven by a combination of rising costs and changing social behaviours.

links.text: -"Pub numbers fall to lowest on record". BBC News. 4 July 2022. Retrieved 4 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: In an interview with the BBC's Chris Mason, Johnson says he had been told about a misconduct complaint against Pincher before appointing him to the role of Deputy Chief Whip in February 2022. Johnson describes his decision as a "bad mistake".

links.text: -Lock, Samantha; Badshah, Nadeem; Sparrow, Andrew (5 July 2022). "Rishi Sunak and Sajid Javid resign as Boris Johnson apologises for Chris Pincher 'mistake' – UK politics live". The Guardian. Retrieved 5 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Sajid Javid resigns as health secretary, saying he "can no longer, in good conscience, continue serving in this government."
Rishi Sunak, the chancellor, also resigns, saying the public expect government to be conducted "properly, competently and seriously."
Andrew Murrison resigns as Prime Ministerial Trade Envoy to Morocco.
Bim Afolami, Vice Chair of the Conservative party, resigns on air during an interview with TalkTV.

Jonathan Gullis resigns as Parliamentary Private Secretary to the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, saying "we have been focused on dealing with our reputational damage rather than delivering for the people."
Saqib Bhatti, Parliamentary Private Secretary to now former health secretary Sajid Javid, also resigns.
Nicola Richards, Parliamentary Private Secretary to the Department for Transport, quits her role, describing the Conservative Party as "currently unrecognisable."
Virginia Crosbie, Parliamentary Private Secretary to the Wales Office, also resigns.
Alex Chalk resigns as Solicitor General, citing the Owen Paterson scandal, Partygate and the Chris Pincher scandal.

links.text: -"tweet announcing resignation". Twitter. 5 July 2022. Retrieved 5 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Saqib Bhatti resigns as Parliamentary Private Secretary to the Secretary of State.

Laura Trott resigns as Parliamentary Private Secretary to the Department for Transport, citing "trust in politics is  and must always be  of the utmost importance, but sadly in recent months this has been lost".

In the latest of a series of climate protests at art museums around the world, Just Stop Oil protestors glue themselves to paintings within the Royal Academy of Arts, including its depiction of The Last Supper.

links.text: -"Just Stop Oil campaigners glue themselves to Da Vinci copy in Royal Academy". The Guardian. 5 July 2022. Retrieved 15 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Will Quince an education minister, resigns after "accepting and repeating assurances to the media [from No 10] which have now been found to be inaccurate".

links.text: -"tweet announcing resignation". Twitter. 6 July 2022. Retrieved 6 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Robin Walker resigns as Minister of State for School Standards, saying he cannot "in good conscience" serve in Johnson's government.

links.text: -"Schools minister Robin Walker resigns". Schools Week. 6 July 2022. Retrieved 6 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: John Glen resigns as Economic Secretary to the Treasury, citing "poor judgment" shown by Johnson.
Victoria Atkins resigns as Minister of State for Prisons and Probation, citing concerns with party leadership.
Jo Churchill resigns as Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Agri-Innovation and Climate Adaptation, citing concerns over "integrity, competence, and judgement" by the Prime Minister.

links.text: -"tweet announcing resignation". Twitter. 6 July 2022. Retrieved 6 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Stuart Andrew resigns as Minister of State for Housing, saying "our great country deserve better."

links.text: -"tweet announcing resignation". Twitter. 6 July 2022. Retrieved 6 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Felicity Buchan resigns as Parliamentary Private Secretary in the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy.

links.text: -"tweet announcing resignation". Twitter. 6 July 2022. Retrieved 6 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Selaine Saxby resigns as Parliamentary Private Secretary to the Treasury, citing concerns over "trust, truth and integrity" in government.

Data.event_text: Five ministers  Kemi Badenoch, Neil O'Brien, Alex Burghart, Lee Rowley and Julia Lopez  issue a joint resignation letter, saying "it has become increasingly clear that the government cannot function given the issues that have come to light" and calling on Johnson to resign. Dozens of further resignations are announced during the next 24 hours, bringing the total to 63, out of 179 Government officials.

Data.event_text: The pound slides to a two-year low against the dollar.

links.text: -"Pound slides to two-year low against the dollar". BBC News. 6 July 2022. Retrieved 6 July 2022.-

links.text: -"Tweet announcing resignation". Twitter. 8 July 2022. Retrieved 8 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: A heat health alert is issued for parts of the UK with temperatures expected to exceed 30 °C in the coming days.

links.text: -"Djokovic recovers against Kyrgios to win Wimbledon". BBC News. Retrieved 10 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: September 2022 Conservative Party leadership election 1922 Committee chair Sir Graham Brady unveils the timetable for the leadership election, with the election due to complete on 5 September.

links.text: -"Next Conservative leader and PM to be unveiled by 5 September". BBC News. 11 July 2022. Retrieved 11 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: As temperatures reach 32 °C in some places, the Met Office issues an extreme weather warning for Sunday 17 July, when temperatures are expected to climb even higher.

links.text: -"UK heatwave: Temperatures rise to 32C amid extreme heat warning". BBC News. 11 July 2022. Retrieved 11 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Members of the Associated Society of Locomotive Engineers and Firemen (ASLEF) at eight train operators vote overwhelmingly to take strike action in a dispute over pay, while members of the Transport Salaried Staffs Association (TSSA) at South Western Railway also vote to take industrial action.

links.text: -"Train drivers vote for rail strikes over pay". BBC News. 11 July 2022. Retrieved 11 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: A report from a three-year inquiry into the child sexual exploitation in Telford is released. It reveals more than 1,000 girls had been abused over a 40-year period, and that agencies blamed victims for the abuse they suffered, not the perpetrators, and exploitation was not investigated because of "nervousness about race" in the belief that investigation against Asian men would inflame "racial tensions". The report makes 47 recommendations for improvement by agencies involved. West Mercia Police apologise "unequivocally" for past events, as well as Telford and Wrekin Council. Victims were often blamed for "child prostitution" and offenders were emboldened by the lack of police action.

September 2022 Conservative Party leadership election Nominations for the election are confirmed, with eight candidates  Kemi Badenoch, Suella Braverman, Jeremy Hunt, Penny Mordaunt, Rishi Sunak, Tom Tugendhat, Liz Truss and Nadhim Zahawi  going into the leadership race. Three candidates – Rehman Chishti, Sajid Javid and Grant Shapps – withdraw before they can be nominated.

links.text: -"UK leader hopefuls battle for support as nominations close". CNBC. 12 July 2022. Retrieved 12 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2022 United Kingdom railway strike Network Rail makes a fresh pay offer worth more than 5%, but linked to workers accepting "modernising reforms".

links.text: -"Network Rail puts fresh pay offer to unions". BBC News. 12 July 2022. Retrieved 13 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: September 2022 Conservative Party leadership election Jeremy Hunt and Nadhim Zahawi are eliminated in the first round of MPs' voting, while Rishi Sunak and Penny Mordaunt emerge as the frontrunners.

links.text: -"Sunak ahead as Hunt and Zahawi knocked out of Tory leadership race". The Guardian. 13 July 2022. Retrieved 13 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The number of confirmed deaths from the virus is reported to have exceeded 200,000. Omicron BA.4 and BA.5 are now the dominant subvariants.

links.text: -"COVID-19: UK deaths pass 200,000, ONS says". Sky News. 13 July 2022. Retrieved 13 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2022 United Kingdom railway strike The National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers (RMT) announces another 24-hour strike for Wednesday 27 July.

links.text: -"Rail strike: New walkout to take place on 27 July". BBC News. 13 July 2022. Retrieved 13 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Met Office extends its severe weather warning to Tuesday 19 July, when temperatures are expected to peak at 36 °C.

links.text: -"Extreme weather warning extended to Tuesday". BBC News. 13 July 2022. Retrieved 13 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: September 2022 Conservative Party leadership election Suella Braverman is knocked out of the contest in the second round of the MPs' ballot, with Sunak and Mordaunt remaining the front runners.

links.text: -"Tory leadership race: Suella Braverman knocked out in latest vote". BBC News. 14 July 2022. Retrieved 14 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2022 United Kingdom railway strike ASLEF announces that train drivers at eight train companies  Arriva Rail London, Chiltern Railways, Great Western Railway, LNER, Greater Anglia, Southeastern, Hull Trains and West Midlands Trains  will strike on 30 July. The RMT also announces strikes at Network Rail and 14 train operators for 18 and 20 August.

links.text: -"Train drivers to go on strike on 30 July". BBC News. 14 July 2022. Retrieved 14 July 2022.-
-"Rail workers to walk out for two days in August". BBC News. 14 July 2022. Retrieved 14 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: A national emergency is declared after a red extreme heat warning is issued by the Met Office for London, the south east and parts of central England as temperatures are expected to reach 40 °C on 18 and 19 July, while the UK Health Security Agency increases its own warning to level four, indicating a risk to life among the fit and healthy.

links.text: -"Heatwave: National emergency declared after UK's first red extreme heat warning". BBC News. 15 July 2022. Retrieved 15 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: The latest Office for National Statistics data for the week ending 8 July indicates 3.5 million people, roughly one in 18, were infected with COVID-19 in that week, up from one in 25, or 2.7 million, the previous week.

links.text: -"One in 18 has Covid in the UK". BBC News. 15 July 2022. Retrieved 15 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: The vaccine booster programme scheduled for the coming autumn is extended to cover all adults over 50, along with younger people considered to be vulnerable and health and social care workers.

links.text: -"Covid booster: Will be offered to all over 50s this autumn". BBC News. 15 July 2022. Retrieved 15 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: 17 July  The UK government confirms that every state school in England will have a defibrillator by summer 2023.Weather warnings in the UK on 18

links.text: -"School defibrillators: State schools to receive life-saving devices by 2023". BBC News. 17 July 2022. Retrieved 17 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: 2022 United Kingdom heatwaves The hottest day of the year is recorded by the Met Office, with a temperature of 38.1 °C  (100.6 °F) in Santon Downham.

links.text: -"UK heatwave: Temperatures rising rapidly as over 40C predicted". BBC News. 18 July 2022. Retrieved 18 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: September 2022 Conservative Party leadership election Tom Tugendhat is eliminated in the third round of the MPs' ballot, with Rishi Sunak leading the votes.

links.text: -"Rishi Sunak tops Tory leadership poll, as Tom Tugendhat out of race". BBC News. 18 July 2022. Retrieved 18 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Johnson Government wins a House of Commons vote of confidence by 349 votes to 238  a majority of 111.

links.text: -"Boris Johnson defends record as government wins confidence vote". The Guardian. 18 July 2022. Retrieved 18 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: Wild bison are reintroduced in the UK for the first time in thousands of years. Three of the animals are allowed to roam in the Kent countryside, where it is hoped they could improve the local ecology.

links.text: -"Wild bison return to UK for first time in thousands of years". The Guardian. 18 July 2022. Retrieved 18 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: The world's largest automated drone superhighway is announced by Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng, connecting several towns across the Midlands, southern, and eastern England.

links.text: -"UK set to have world's biggest automated drone superhighway". BBC News. 18 July 2022. Retrieved 18 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: A temperature above 40 °C is recorded for the first time in the UK, with a provisional Met Office reading of 40.3 °C at Coningsby, Lincolnshire beating the previous record high of 38.7 °C set in Cambridge in . A record night-time temperature is also recorded for 1819 July, with 25.9 °C at Emley Moor, West Yorkshire. This is an increase of 2 °C from the previous record, set in Brighton in . Temperatures in many other parts of the country did not fall below 25 °C, giving the UK its warmest tropical night on record.

links.text: -"UK records temperature above 40C for first time". BBC News. 19 July 2022. Retrieved 19 July 2022.-
-"Temperature records fall as heatwave continues". BBC News. 19 July 2022. Retrieved 19 July 2022.-
-Cuff, Madeleine (19 July 2022). "Why 'tropical nights' when temperatures fail to drop below 20°C are so harmful". inews.co.uk. Retrieved 19 July 2022.-

Data.event_text: A major incident is declared in London, with more than 250 firefighters battling grassfires in the east and south of the capital. As a result, London Fire Brigade has its busiest day since World War Two.

links.text: -"Major incident declared in London as fires burn". BBC News. 19 July 2022. Retrieved 19 July 2022.-
-"London Fire Brigade had busiest day since World War Two, says London mayor". BBC News. 20 July 2022. Retrieved 20 July 2022.-

links.text: -"Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss to face off in final round of Tory leadership race". The Guardian. 20 July 2022. Retrieved 20 July 2022.-

The ONS figures show a slow in the growth of cases while data from other sources, such as the government's COVID-19 Dashboard, suggest the latest wave has already reached its peak.

Data.event_text: As a prolonged dry spell continues in Southern England, a hosepipe ban is announced for Kent and Sussex from 12 August.

links.text: -"Kent and Sussex hosepipe ban announced from 12 August". BBC News. 3 August 2022. Retrieved 3 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: Marks and Spencer announces that it will stop selling disposable barbecues "to help protect open spaces and reduce the risk of fires".

links.text: -"M&S stops selling disposable barbecues across UK". BBC News. 3 August 2022. Retrieved 3 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: Sir Patrick Vallance, the UK Government's Chief Scientific Adviser who helped steer the UK through the COVID-19 pandemic, announces he will step down from the role in April 2023.

links.text: -"Patrick Vallance: One of government's chief Covid advisers is stepping down". BBC News. 3 August 2022. Retrieved 3 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: 4 August  The Bank of England raises its base interest rate from 1.25% to 1.75%, the biggest increase in 27 years. The Bank also warns that inflation could reach 13% later in the year and that the British economy may enter a recession.

links.text: -"Interest rates rise to 1.75% – the biggest jump in 27 years". BBC News. 4 August 2022. Retrieved 4 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: Network Rail management staff belonging to the Transport Salaried Staffs' Association vote to accept a 4% pay rise.

links.text: -"Network Rail managers accept 4% pay rise that could ease strike disruption". The Guardian. 5 August 2022. Retrieved 5 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Unite union announces that 1,900 workers at Felixstowe Docks, one of the UK's largest ports, will stage an eight-day strike from 21 August after rejecting a 7% pay rise from the Felixstowe Dock and Railway Company.

links.text: -"Felixstowe: Workers at key UK port to strike for eight days". BBC News. 5 August 2022. Retrieved 5 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The latest Office for National Statistics (ONS) data shows another drop in the number of people in the UK with COVID-19, with 2.6 million cases in the week up to 26 July, a fall of over half a million from 3.2 million the previous week.

links.text: -"Covid infections continuing to fall around the UK". BBC News. 5 August 2022. Retrieved 5 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: It is confirmed that a software outage affecting some NHS services, such as NHS 111, the previous day was the result of software hackers.

links.text: -"NHS 111 software outage confirmed as cyber-attack". BBC News. 5 August 2022. Retrieved 5 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: 12-year-old Archie Battersbee dies after his life support machine is switched off, following a series of legal challenges by his parents attempting to keep him alive.

links.text: -"Archie Battersbee 'fought until the end', says mum after son dies". BBC News. 6 August 2022. Retrieved 6 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: Former Prime Minister Gordon Brown, writing in The Observer, urges the government to introduce an emergency budget before the next round of energy price rises, in order to avoid "a financial timebomb [that] will explode for families in October".

links.text: -"Gordon Brown demands emergency budget before 'financial timebomb'". BBC News. 7 August 2022. Retrieved 7 August 2022.-
-"Gordon Brown: 'Set emergency budget or risk a winter of dire poverty'". The Guardian. 6 August 2022. Retrieved 7 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: England finish the 2022 Commonwealth Games in second place behind Australia with 176 medals, 97 of them gold, surpassing their 2014 total of 174.

links.text: -"England seal record Commonwealth medal haul". BBC News. Retrieved 8 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: As the UK prepares for another heatwave, the UK Health Security Agency issues a level 3 heat health alert for central and southern England effective from 9 to 13 August.

links.text: -"UK weather: Second highest health alert level issued for England as another heatwave to last longer than one last month". Sky News. Retrieved 8 August 2022.-

links.text: -"Thames Water plans to introduce hosepipe ban 'in weeks'". BBC News. 9 August 2022. Retrieved 9 August 2022.-

links.text: -"Energy bill crisis is on scale of pandemic, Martin Lewis says". BBC News. 10 August 2022. Retrieved 10 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: A meeting of the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation recommends an urgent polio vaccine booster campaign for children aged one to nine in London, following detection of the virus in 116 samples of wastewater.

Data.event_text: One person is killed and three are injured during the Skye and Wester Ross attacks.

links.text: -"One dead, three injured in string of attacks round Skye". BBC News. 10 August 2022. Retrieved 21 February 2023.-

Data.event_text: The Prime Minister, Chancellor, and Business Secretary meet representatives of energy companies to discuss the ongoing price rises, but the meeting concludes without any firm resolution.

-"People can't wait for energy help – Citizens Advice". BBC News. 11 August 2022. Retrieved 11 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Met Office issues a fire severity alert over the coming weekend, warning there is an "exceptional" risk of fire spreading in some areas.

links.text: -"UK heatwave: Soaring temperatures prompt wildfire warnings". BBC News. 11 August 2022. Retrieved 11 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: A drought is declared in large parts of Central, Southern and Eastern England.

links.text: -"Hosepipe ban: Millions more face restrictions as drought is declared". BBC News. 12 August 2022. Retrieved 12 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: The ONS reports that the UK economy shrank by 0.1% between April and June.

links.text: -"UK economy shrinks as outlook on recession darkens". BBC News. 12 August 2022. Retrieved 12 August 2022.-

Data.event_text: Tesco announces an increase in automated self-checkout services within its larger stores, following successful trials.
